etymology.description: Depicts a tiger's head (虎) with torso transformed to 人(人) (rén, "person") in small seal script -> 儿(儿) (ér, "son") in clerical script
etymology.interpretation: 虎(hǔ) captures the powerful and recognizable features of a tiger, emphasizing the head since the torso was stylized to resemble human-like forms in later scripts.

examples.chinese: 老虎是森林之王(老虎是森林之王)。
examples.english: The tiger is the king of the forest.

examples.chinese: 动物园里有一只虎(動物園裡有一隻虎)，吸引了很多游客(吸引了很多遊客)。
examples.pinyin: Dòngwùyuán lǐ yǒuyī zhī hǔ, xīyǐnle hěn duō yóukè.
examples.english: There is a tiger in the zoo, attracting many visitors.

examples.chinese: 山林中虎啸之声回荡(山林中虎嘯之聲迴盪)，令人心生敬畏(令人心生敬畏)。
examples.pinyin: Shānlín zhōng hǔ xiào zhī shēng huídàng, lìng rén xīnshēng jìngwèi.
examples.english: In the mountains, the tiger's roar echoes, evoking awe.
